bibl.title: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Caroline Latimer, June 14, 1908

div1.p: The Kissingers fear they may have offended Kelly.

div1.head: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Caroline Latimer, June 14, 1908
div1.opener:
Need not return
June 14 08
Caroline Latimer
Dear Kind friend
div1.p:
your express Package received a
few days ago and I was very glad
to get It but they were something I
could not wear. I am a much larger
woman than yourself- but I do thank
you for your thoughtfulness and I
will try to realize Something out of
them they were very nice and if I
could wear then I would have been
most Pleased: Say dear friend can
you explain to us why Dr Kelly has
Never answered our letter and Seemed
to be offended at Something I am
Very Sorry if any thing has been
Said or done to offend if so Some
explination might make It all right
if you know would you be pleased to
explain to us.

would like to hear from you I
sent you a letter last week.
I have realized so much good
out of what you Sent me' I can
not thank you enough- well I will
say thank you and Good by' with
love and Kindest Regards from
my self and Mr. Kissinger
div1.closer:
We are as ever your true
friends Mr. and Mrs John R Kissinger 810 Milton ave
South Bend
Ind.
